alert.note: Alert for Aurora; Beadle; Davison; Douglas; Jerauld; Sanborn (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 25 at 2:07AM MST until December 25 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected, with mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM CST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 3 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of sleet or light freezing rain is possible during the late morning or early afternoon. Please monitor for updates if you have travel plans.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Aurora; Beadle; Davison; Douglas; Jerauld; Sanborn
